metadata.title: CVE-2024-56632 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-tcp: fix the memleak while create new ctrl failedNow while we create new ctrl failed, we have not free thetagset occupied by admin_q, here try to fix it.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
